title: World War II Begins
description: Germany invades Poland, marking the beginning of World War II in Europe.

title: Moon Landing
description: Apollo 11 astronauts Neil Armstrong and Buzz Aldrin become the first humans to walk on the Moon.

title: Fall of the Berlin Wall
description: The Berlin Wall falls, symbolizing the end of the Cold War and division of Germany.

title: Declaration of Independence
description: The United States Declaration of Independence is adopted by the Continental Congress.

title: French Revolution Begins
description: The Storming of the Bastille marks the beginning of the French Revolution.

title: First Powered Flight
description: The Wright Brothers achieve the first powered, sustained, and controlled airplane flight.

title: Discovery of Penicillin
description: Alexander Fleming discovers penicillin, revolutionizing medicine and antibiotics.

title: Indian Independence
description: India gains independence from British colonial rule.

title: First Internet Message
description: The first message is sent over ARPANET, the precursor to the modern Internet.

title: Nelson Mandela Released
description: Nelson Mandela is released from prison after 27 years, marking a turning point in South African history.

title: First Human in Space
description: Soviet cosmonaut Yuri Gagarin becomes the first human to journey into outer space.

title: Chernobyl Disaster
description: The Chernobyl nuclear power plant explodes, causing the worst nuclear disaster in history.

title: World Wide Web Launched
description: Tim Berners-Lee makes the World Wide Web publicly available, transforming global communication.

title: Hiroshima Atomic Bombing
description: The United States drops the first atomic bomb on Hiroshima, Japan.

title: Christopher Columbus Reaches Americas
description: Christopher Columbus and his crew reach the Americas, beginning European exploration of the New World.
